channel.title: infra on sambaiz-net
channel.description: Recent content in infra on sambaiz-net

item.title: Increase the maximum number of file descriptors
item.description: What is file descriptors? File desecriptors is an identifier for interacting with an outside of a process. In POSIX, it is an int type, 0 is stdin, 1 is stdout, and 2 is stderr. It is assigned by a system call such as open() to open files and devices, and socket() to create sockets to communicate with other processes. Maximum number of file descriptors There is a limit on the number of file descriptors a process can use so that one process does not consumpt all resources.
